formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: The current verification isn't working very well, as there are too many small details that aren't getting handled. This is partly because it's not very easy for a single person to do verification on their own code. We really need two people to do that. On the other hand, examining the set of errors that seem to occur, it would be easier for an automated system to verify these problems, and that would probably improve the reliability of the verification process. This is especially true given that only a single user is developing this stuff right now.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: This could definitely be done, but what the best means to do it remains a little unknown. I recommend that the first effort should be a new implementation of APL primitives which operate over abstract array descriptions rather than on their data. This should allow for a form of abstract interpretation that will deliver the appropriate level of rigor to eliminate the majority of the errors that occur while doing the program design.
